abstract: Case in which computer technology distributors Ayman Ammar and Rashid Albuni, of United Arab Emirates, were charged with smuggling surveillance technology to repressive Syrian government reflects conflict between American government and tech industry over exports; industry has fiercely opposed restrictions on exports, despite technology's potential for misuse by repressive regimes; government has been cautious in regulating equipment also used for free communication by dissidents and others.
lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley is resisting federal plans to increase regulations on exports of “dual use” technology like servers and software used in social media that can also be used for spying.

headline.main: Battle Heats Up Over Exports of Surveillance Technology
headline.print_headline: A Syrian Case Reflects a Battle on Tech Exports

snippet: Silicon Valley is resisting federal plans to increase regulations on exports of “dual use” technology like servers and software used in social media that can also be used for spying.
